data.title: Barcode
data.description_Home: The Barcode Job allows reading barcodes of components to be assembled, both in standard and two-dimensional formats such as PDF417, Datamatrix or QR Code, using a barcode reader.

data.title: Pick To Light
data.description_Home: The Pick To Light Job assists the operator in picking or placing components, using indicator lights and photocells that control and confirm the correct execution of the task.

data.title: Screwing
data.description_Home: The Screwing Job uses screwdrivers with electronic control units to tighten screws, controlling torque and angle, with the option to add a reaction arm to manage positions.

data.title: Key Screwing
data.description_Home: The Key Screwing Job uses electronic torque wrenches to perform screwing, monitoring torque and angle, and optionally controlling positions with ultrasonic devices.

data.title: Riveting
data.description_Home: The Riveting Job consists of assembling rivets and verifying the results by monitoring the oil pressure in the pneumatic system or reading results from the riveting unit's control unit, if present.

data.title: Seeger
data.description_Home: The Seeger Job uses a tool equipped with a pneumatic cylinder, with execution time setting and monitoring of the applied force, detected through a load cell.

data.title: Collaborative Robot
data.description_Home: The Robot Job uses a collaborative robot that efficiently and precisely performs specific pre-configured operations selected via TCP-IP protocol commands.

data.title: Seat Belt
data.description_Home: The Seat Belt Job checks the correct operation of car seat belts by measuring the resistance or the current absorbed by it, both with and without the tongue inserted.

data.title: Seat Belt Release
data.description_Home: The Seat Belt Release Job checks car seat belts by applying controlled tension through a sled with stepper motor and load cell. A probe measures the release force.

data.title: Airbag
data.description_Home: The Airbag Job checks automotive airbags by injecting a low current into the circuit to prevent accidental detonations and measuring the voltage across the resistor to ensure it meets preset values.

data.title: Heating Pad
data.description_Home: The Heating Pad Job checks the heater, verifying whether the current absorbed or the heater resistance, along with the temperature sensor resistance, are valid.

data.title: Killer Switch
data.description_Home: The Killer Switch Job checks the correct operation of this automotive safety device, ensuring it correctly transitions from inactive to active state and vice versa.

data.title: TPS
data.description_Home: The TPS Job checks this device with a Hall effect sensor, used to monitor the position of car seats along the tracks, ensuring the correct state transition from OFF to ON and back to OFF.

data.title: DPD-SBR Presence Sensor
data.description_Home: The DPD-SBR Job checks the correct operation of the car seat passenger presence sensor, verifying that the activation state is correct based on the loaded weight.

data.title: Dimensional
data.description_Home: The Dimensional Job checks the dimensions of a component by placing it on a gauge with support bushings. It uses a pneumatic probe with a linear potentiometer to perform measurements at specific points.

data.title: Manual Load
data.description_Home: The Manual Load Job checks that the peak force, measured using a dynamometric tool with a load cell, remains within a range of preset values.

data.title: Load
data.description_Home: The Load Job checks if the peak force, measured using a load cell placed at the front of a motorized sled, stays within a predefined reference range.

data.title: Torque
data.description_Home: The Torque Job verifies and ensures that the torque produced by a gear motor, driven by a stepper motor to rotate a shaft or knob, does not exceed predefined limits.

data.title: Motor
data.description_Home: The Motor Job monitors the peak and/or average current absorbed by a DC motor over a defined period, ensuring the values obtained remain within preset limits.

data.title: Vision
data.description_Home: The Vision Job captures images of the product using up to four LAN cameras. The images are stored and/or analyzed to extract useful data using recognition algorithms.

data.title: Objectification
data.description_Home: The Objectification Job assists the operator in performing specific tasks, such as confirming operations on a monitor or via sensors, weighing with electronic scales, and control using machine vision.

data.title: Quality
data.description_Home: The Quality Job enables operators to identify defects during product quality control by selecting anomalies from a predefined list, improving process effectiveness.

data.title: Quality Wall
data.description_Home: The Quality Wall Job evaluates product quality with an image and a message to guide the operator in rating and choosing the non-conformity category to be recorded in a report.

data.title: Scrap
data.description_Home: The Scrap Job facilitates the identification and reporting of any defects in components intended for assembly, allowing operators to select anomalies from a predefined list.

data.title: Logistics
data.description_Home: The Logistics Job allows operators to report material shortages for processing, facilitating the replenishment request to the workstation and ensuring production continuity.

data.title: Maintenance
data.description_Home: The Maintenance Job allows reporting issues at the workstation, indicated as 'Operational Machine', allowing continued work, or 'Stopped Machine', halting the production cycle.

data.title: Report
data.description_Home: The Report Job displays an image and a message to guide the operator in entering a parameter description or selecting it from a predefined list to be recorded in a report.

data.title: Printing
data.description_Home: The Printing Job allows creating custom labels, configurable in terms of size, border or line layout, simple texts or with processing data, barcodes, and logos loaded from files.

data.title: Clamping
data.description_Home: The Clamping Job flexibly manages the movement of a pneumatic cylinder using solenoid valves to control forward and backward movement, monitoring the two positions with proximity sensors.

data.title: Hoist
data.description_Home: The Hoist Job automatically controls the movement of a hoist, activating the lift, descent, and locking solenoid valves. The position is monitored by two end-of-stroke proximity sensors.

data.title: Input Output
data.description_Home: The Input-Output Job manages the sequential and timed activation and deactivation of the control station outputs based on the status of the inputs and configuration parameters.

data.title: Jump
data.description_Home: The Jump Job allows moving to another job in the configuration file independently or based on the outcome of the previous job. It is also possible to close the operation, simulating the end.

data.title: Timer
data.description_Home: The Timer Job can interrupt the cycle for a set period or allow work to continue while the time is counted in the background, eventually changing the status of an output.

data.title: SCU
data.description_Home: The SCU Job configures and verifies car seats managed by electronic control units with CAN bus. It performs advanced diagnostics, analyzes hardware and software serial numbers, and calibrates movements.

data.title: OCS Bodysense
data.description_Home: The OCS-Bodysense Job manages electronic control units for car seats with OCS (Occupant Classification Sensing) technology, performing configurations, calibrations, and checks for correct weight detection.

data.title: ECU Heater
data.description_Home: The ECU-Heater Job checks automotive heating pads managed by electronic control units with LIN interface, sending activation commands with additional control of the absorbed current.

data.title: ECU Massaging
data.description_Home: The ECU-Massaging Job controls electronic control units with LIN interface for the car seat massage system, sending activation commands and monitoring the received responses.
